title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 December 2011 - XWiki
content: 00:25  has quit 01:00  has joined #xwiki 01:00  has quit 01:43  has quit 02:21  has quit 03:18  has joined #xwiki 03:26  has quit 03:28  has joined #xwiki 05:42  has quit 06:00  has joined #xwiki 06:00  has quit 07:47  has joined #xwiki 08:15  has joined #xwiki 08:39  has quit 08:57  is now known as 08:58  has joined #xwiki 09:03  has quit 09:12  has joined #xwiki 09:26  has joined #xwiki 09:27  has quit 09:34  has joined #xwiki 09:44  has joined #xwiki 09:46  has quit 09:54  has joined #xwiki 10:05  has joined #xwiki 10:12  has quit 10:15  has joined #xwiki 11:04  has left #xwiki 11:04  has joined #xwiki 12:53  has joined #xwiki 13:22  has quit 13:44  fyi I've started an experiment over the week end: create a maven plugin to create a xwiki packager to easily generate a jetty/hsqldb distribution 13:45  the idea is to use this to write functional tests in platform modules (this is the experiment) 13:45  actually I've not started a new plugin, I've started added a new mojo to our packager plugin 13:46  has joined #xwiki 13:46  has joined #xwiki 13:46  has quit 13:46 <16SAACHWT> has quit 13:46  has quit 13:46  has joined #xwiki 13:46  (I've started doing this since I introduced a technical debt when adding the link checker module for which I have no functional tests ATM) 13:46  (and I'd like to reduce that debt) 13:47  I probably need 1 to 2 hours more to finish a first version 13:51  mf 13:51  oops 13:51  has quit 13:52  has joined #xwiki 13:57  has quit 13:59  has joined #xwiki 14:38 <+sburjan> vmassol1: hello :) 14:38 <+sburjan> is User Status part of User Application ? 14:39  sburjan: hi. Everything you see in the user profile is part of it yes 14:39  (all the tabs) 14:40 <+sburjan> even My Dashboard ? My Dashboard is already documented in Dashboard Application 14:40  hold on 14:40  those: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-user/xwiki-platform-user-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki 14:40  -preferences 14:40  has joined #xwiki 14:40  - network 14:41  -profile 14:41  not dashbard indeed 14:41 <+sburjan> and I guess watchlist if part of watchlist application too... so that doesn;t go either 14:41  yep 14:41 <+sburjan> ok, thanks 14:50  sburjan: also pick a nice icon for the user app :) 14:50  (so that it looks nice on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features ) 14:52 <+mflorea> vmassol1: I picked application\_form\_add, but it's small compared with the rest of the icons 14:52  it's ok mflorea, evalica is on this 14:52 <+mflorea> cool 14:52  (for the icon homogeneization) 14:53  has quit 14:59  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r7237435 / (9 files in 3 dirs): Add more functional tests for App Within Minutes. - http://git.io/1rdhFA 15:00  has quit 15:00  has quit 15:01  Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.3.x \* rf2133b4 / (9 files in 3 dirs): Add more functional tests for App Within Minutes. ... 15:06  has joined #xwiki 15:13  tmortagne: shouldn't we be able to start XE even if there's no extension manager module? I think we should. Right now it gives a large stack trace. 15:14  hmm wait 15:14  I think I misread the stack trace 15:14  checking more 15:16 <+tmortagne> vmassol1: depends what's missing and why but if you don't have any EM jar in XE there is no reason for it to not start 15:17  I think I just hit some missing dependency in some pom.xml 15:23  guys refresh your cache and check http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features, caty has done some magic to hide the differences of icon sizes 15:24  tmortagne: I know what the problem is 15:25 <+tmortagne> vmassol1: ? 15:25  the script macro requires an implementation for 15:26      @Inject 15:26      @Named("attachmentjar") 15:26      private ExtendedURLStreamHandler attachmentJarHander; 15:26  (typo in the field name btw ;)) 15:26  but it's declared as a runtime dep 15:26  so when I resolve the deps it's not copied 15:27 <+tmortagne> what you mean by "resolve" ? 15:28 <+tmortagne> the only difference between runtime and default dependency is that the runtime dependency is not in the classpath when compiling the .java 15:29 <+tmortagne> but you should have it during test or when building a the war 15:30  has joined #xwiki 15:30  sorry, internet connection dropped... 15:30 <+tmortagne> (03:27:58 PM) tmortagne: what you mean by "resolve" ? 15:30 <+tmortagne> (03:29:22 PM) tmortagne: the only difference between runtime and default dependency is that the runtime dependency is not in the classpath when compiling the .java 15:30 <+tmortagne> (03:30:14 PM) tmortagne: but you should have it during test or when building a the war 15:31  has quit 15:32  tmortagne: I'm in a maven plugin and using this.project.getArtifacts(); 15:32  I can get access to the runtime artifacts if I want (AFAIR) 15:32  there's a getRuntimeArtifacts 15:32 <+tmortagne> ok you are doing the resolve yourself 15:32  yep 15:32  I guess I should copy the runtime ones too 15:33 <+tmortagne> since you were talking about XE I was a bit lost 15:33  I'm creating a maven plugin to create custom distributions of platform 15:33 <+tmortagne> then yes you should teke runtime dependcies too 15:33  right now the only dep I have in my test is a dep on oldcore 15:33  which drags almost everything 15:33  ok I'll fix this 15:35 <+tmortagne> but you probably need to skip optionnal dependencies probably 15:35  yep 15:35  I don't think they're included by default 15:42  tmortagne: ok I know, it's because I had:  \* @requiresDependencyResolution compile 15:42  (I think) 15:42 <+tmortagne> yep I think that's it, I have the same issue with xar plugin 15:43 <+tmortagne> this thing means that you will only get compile dependencies resolved IIRW 15:43  ok apparently I need "compile+runtime " 15:43  but that's maven 3.0 so I'll need to update the maven dep for the plugin 15:43 <+tmortagne> runtime insluce compile 15:43  http://maven.apache.org/developers/mojo-api-specification.html 15:43 <+tmortagne> include 15:43  it doesn't apparently 15:43  according to http://maven.apache.org/developers/mojo-api-specification.html 15:43  sorry it des 15:43  does 15:43  misread 15:43  it's system and provided 15:43  that are not included 15:43  my bad 15:44 <+tmortagne> yep 15:49  has joined #xwiki 15:51  hmm 15:52  we need to move to servlet 3 …. 15:52  because right now we need org.xwiki.wysiwyg.server.filter.ConversionFilter to start with our default web.xml 15:53  and if we don't want wysiwyg support we shouldn't mandate it 15:54  see http://www.servletworld.com/servlet-tutorials/servlet3/new-features.html 15:56  I guess we could start using servlet 3 annotations (it wouldn't hurt) and not provide a web.xml file by default but make one available for supporting older servlet containers 16:00  has quit 16:00  has joined #xwiki 16:12  has joined #xwiki 16:32 <+Denis> Enygma`: ping ? 16:38 <+Enygma`> Denis: pong 16:38 <+Denis> Workspace introduce a menu on a subwiki ? 16:38  has joined #xwiki 16:42 <+Enygma`> hm, I think I know what you mean... 16:42 <+Enygma`> are you having a translations issue on subwikis? 16:43 <+Enygma`> in the user profile menu 16:44  In velocity, when I write $xwiki.getURL($doc.fullName, "edit", ""), the result is: "xwiki/bin/edit/Space/Page", but how can I get the url with the "http://server/" part? 16:45  gdelhumeau: you shouldn't need the full URL normally 16:45  why do you need it? 16:45  for a wiki link? 16:45  because I want a link like this "http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/Macros/NewPage?editor=object&classname=XWiki.WikiMacroClass&object=0" 16:46  yes but a best practice is to let the browser compute the full url 16:46  now if you really need full URL the api is $xwiki.getExternalURL() AFAIR (but there are few cases where you really need this) 16:47  I agree, but I didn't manage to get an URL for the object editor by the normal way 16:47  maybe I made a mistake 16:47  I don't understand 16:47  what does full URL have to do with object editor? 16:48  $xwiki.getURL(…) will get you the URL 16:48  I do $xwiki.getURL($doc.fullName, "edit", "editor=object&classname=XWiki.WikiMacroClass&object=$i") 16:49  and then, the link starts to "xwiki/bin/..." 16:49  sounds good 16:49  and? 16:49  :) 16:49  so the browser tries to compute from the current url 16:49 <+Denis> Enygma`: yes I have, and I also wonder why I have that menu ? 16:49  you're doing js? 16:49  so I get "current\_url/my\_wanted\_url" 16:49  no no, just an HTML link 16:50  try [[my label>>path:$xwiki.getURL($doc.fullName, "edit", "editor=object&classname=XWiki.WikiMacroClass&object=$i")]] in syntax 2.1 16:50  or in HTML: label 16:52  gdelhumeau: see http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA 16:52 <+Enygma`> Denis: right now the translations are registered at wiki level (and not by using ApplicationResources) so that's why you don`t have the translation keys set up right. 16:52  With the fiest code, I get "my label" 16:52 <+Enygma`> regarding the actual menus themselves, they appear because you have Workspaces installed 16:53 <+Enygma`> I think one way of getting rid of them is by removing WorkspaceManager.WebHome from the main menu (or renaming it to something else) 16:53  \*first 16:53  gdelhumeau: I've updated http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA to show the 2 possibilites 16:53 <+Denis> Enygma`: not sure to follow 16:53 <+Enygma`> Denis: those menus also appear only for global users 16:54 <+Denis> Enygma`: do you mean that because I have follow the link to Workspace.Install, I have got them ? 16:55 <+Enygma`> no. You have the menus because the Workspace Application is present on your XWiki. 16:55 <+Enygma`> it does not matter if you followed or not WorkspaceManager.Install 16:56  ok, the strange thing is that I have an other comportement on my local wiki (3.2) 16:56 <+Enygma`> and since you have the Workspace app installed, those menus appear only to global users (that can create workspaces and that are aware of this feature) 16:56 <+Enygma`> subwiki local users should not be affected 16:58 <+tmortagne> gdelhumeau: vmassol used 2.1 syntaxe, looks like you are trying to do [[xwiki.getURL($doc.fullName, "edit", "editor=object&classname=XWiki.WikiMacroClass&object=$i")]] in 2.0 syntax 16:58 <+tmortagne> [[$xwiki.getURL($doc.fullName, "edit", "editor=object&classname=XWiki.WikiMacroClass&object=$i")]] 16:59 <+Denis> Enygma`: mmm, but since I have not really install workspace, these menu are useless and could not work, this is confusing 16:59 <+tmortagne> in 2.0 you will have to use html for partial URL because the parser thing it's a document name 16:59 <+tmortagne> it it produce you a link to create the document "/xwiki/bin/edit/Macros/NewPage?editor=object&classname=XWiki.WikiMacroClass&object=0" 17:00  I get this result: 17:00 <+Enygma`> Denis: if you have XEM, you have installed Workspaces. Maybe not installed completely, but you have it installed :) 17:00 <+Denis> Enygma`: by the way, I have followed the link to the install page per curiosity, and because the home page had some untranslated stuffs 17:00 <+tmortagne> so either you use 2.1 syntax with path prefix like vmassol did or you use html macro in 2.0 syntaxe 17:00 <+Enygma`> Denis: what stuff? 17:00 <+tmortagne> gdelhumeau: ok but what is your source ? 17:00  (I put the 2 examples in my page at http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA) 17:00  I use yours for this result 17:01 <+tmortagne> as I told you this does not work in 2.0 syntax 17:01 <+tmortagne> I did not told you to use that :) 17:01 <+Denis> Enygma`: in the tree on the home 17:01 <+Denis> your install page also install some translation for them 17:03 <+Enygma`> ah, right... probably the workspaces macro 17:03 <+Denis> Enygma`: when you means to global users, do you want to means global users or only global admins ? 17:04 <+Enygma`> workspaces is usable by global users, not only admins; so it's displayed to all users of the main wiki 17:08  My Problem: http://pastebin.com/pHP11Yus , but it works well on PlayGround... (2d try) 17:10 <+Denis> Enygma`: you should really enhance in the release notes the fact that upgrading user that do not want the new Workspace feature should not install the XEM xar, but the XE xar and the WikiManager application only. 17:11 <+Enygma`> Denis: you are right 17:13 <+Denis> By the way, where are the links to the release notes ? 17:13 <+Denis> vmassol, it seems Sergui does not put them 17:15 <+Denis> vmassol: you forget XEM 17:15  Denis: could you addi t? 17:20  tmortagne feature-extension-versions \* r957330f / (37 files in 18 dirs): XWIKI-7240: Add support for special versions qualifiers and version ... 17:21 <+tmortagne> gdelhumeau: what syntax are you using ? 17:22  XWiki 2.0 17:22 <+tmortagne> what you have on http://pastebin.com/pHP11Yus  cannot work with xwiki/2.0 syntax for sure 17:23 <+tmortagne> are you sure you are testing with xwiki/2.0 on playground ? 17:23  Oh Ok. i switched to 2.1 and I have the good result 17:23  sorry, I didn't notice this parameter 17:24  so I tried with 2.1 on playground (I used the vincent's page) 17:24 <+tmortagne> there is not mouch difference between 2.1 and 2.0 except for this particular case ;) 17:24 <+tmortagne> \*much 17:25 <+tmortagne> you can't use 2.0 link syntax to display a relative link, you have to use html 17:25  ok :) 17:26  you have resolved my problem :) 17:26 <+tmortagne> note that we should shortly make the 2.1 syntax final and there is no difference with the 2.1 syntax in 3.2 so you can safely use it it's not going to change 17:26 <+Denis> Enygma`: if we follow XE install + WikiManager, we do not have the manager dashboard anymore, neither we have the wikis link in the left panel 17:27 <+Denis> the XWikiServerXWiki initial server page does not exist either 17:28 <+Denis> I do not see the point to keep the old manager dashboard in XEM if we should not install it 17:35 <+Denis> the Application manager is also partially installed 17:35 <+Denis> Enygma`: the best would not be to install all ui and deselect the workspace manager ? 17:36 <+Denis> and maybe the Main.WebHome and to rename the WikiManager.Dashboard to Main.WebHome ? 17:39 <+Enygma`> Denis: sorry for the lag. I`m taking care of something right now and I can`t really concentrate. 17:40 <+Denis> Enygma`: no pb, just putting my thoughts as it cames 17:43 <+Denis> Enygma`: seem there is also issue with macros 17:43  has joined #xwiki 17:43 <+Denis> in a subwiki, I get Unknown macro: activity, spaces and tagcloud now 17:45 <+Enygma`> if it's a regular subwiki and not a workspaces, then it's not related to Workspaces 17:46  has quit 17:48 <+Denis> Enygma`: possible this is something else 17:50 <+Denis> I really think that the best compromise is to install XEM and not install the workspace manager, then rename the WikiDashboard to Main.WebHome and you get really near what old XEM was 17:52 <+Denis> mmm but renaming is not easy due to parent links… :( 17:53 <+Denis> replacing the content of Main.WebHome by {{include document='WikiManager.Dashboard' context='new' /}} is easier 18:08  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r2a868f3 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ClassSheet.xml : XE-1067: XWiki.ClassSheet doesn't detect properly the class template - http://git.io/iZ8oAw 18:08  Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.3.x \* r8c83a22 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ClassSheet.xml : XE-1067: XWiki.ClassSheet doesn't detect properly the class template ... 18:14  Is a good idea to put some HTML code on the JSON results file used by a livetable? (see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Livetable+Macro - "Custom JSON" part) 18:16  gdelhumeau: depends, most of the time you don't have the choice if you wish to add some extra niceties 18:16  what's your use case? 18:16  I'm doing a livetable which displays all the macros 18:17  and, on the "visibility" column, I want the HTML input to set the value 18:17  hmm so you wish to do live editing? 18:17  yes :) 18:18  I have never done this but I know jerome velociter or ludovic dubost have done it 18:18  there might be an extension somewhere for doing this but it may not have been published on e.x.o 18:18  I do this for my last training day 18:20  well if you find how to do this, it might be good to document it somewhere :) 18:20  it's not that hard probably though 18:20  you inject some HTML somehow, either with JS or with the returned JSON 18:21  and then you'll need to do Ajax request to use the propadd/edit/remove actions 18:21  and then use JS to refresh the LT content 18:21  exactly 18:21  … something like that I think (I've never done it though) 18:22  bbl 18:22  so, it leads me to that question: can I have the html code for this "$doc.display("visibility", "edit", $macro)" with "get" action and outputSyntax=plain? 18:23  I believe doc.display use the current rendering system, so it displays nothing on "get" 18:23  but I would like to get what the HTML renderer would do 18:29  I don't know what the best to achieve what you want, you could ask someone with the knowledge. However to get the HTML, it's easy just put what you want in a wiki page, and check the rendered source code 18:32  vmassol> Yes, but the HTML may evolve in the future (if another choice for "visibility" is created, for example) , so I will have to do the update manually. But, it could be a solution. 18:33  a better solution is to use the code directly in the JSON so that it's evaluated 18:33  (and rendered in html) 18:33  $doc.display generates HTML 18:33  yep, but livetable query the JSON page in plain text 18:34  so the HTML is not generated 18:34  ? 18:34  has quit 18:34  the velocity macro is executed 18:34  if you have $doc.display in it, it'll get executed and generate HTML 18:35  the display method is some old method which incorrectly generates HTML if you prefer 18:35  since then we've added the rendering engine to support multiple syntaxes 18:35  in the future we're going to add {{display}} macros that generate XDOM 18:35  instead of generating HTML 18:35  when I do doc.display(...) I get the HTML, but if I access the page like that "xwiki/bin/get/MacrosEditor/ResultsPage?outputSyntax=plain", the HTML is not generated 18:36  it makes sense, of course, but since I'm trying to do something tricky... 18:37 <+Denis> Enygma': I have install XEM with Workspace.Manger, and change the include on WebHome, it seems the nice way to go for me. But on subwikis, I notice that even if the menu has gone, there is a >> before the WIKI: wikiname menu which is probably not expected 18:37 <+Denis> s/with/without 18:42  gdelhumeau: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA and http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA 18:42  both generate HTML 18:42  (with get it's just not rendered as HTML but that's not a problem, the livetable will still get it) 18:44  actually I don't know enough to help you here without trying to do what you're working on 18:44  as I said I've never done this 18:44  vmassol> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/get/Main/VMA?outputSyntax=plain 18:45  I have no idea why get action with outputsyntax is empty 18:45  would need to look at the code 18:46  ah I know 18:46  it's because it's producing a RawBlock I think 18:46  which is ignored by the plain renderer 18:46  but as I said I have no idea what you're doing 18:46  so that doesn't help 18:47  don't use outputxyntax=plain if it doesn't do what you want :) 18:47  vmassol> I agree, but LiveTable does :) 18:49  I'd give the same suggestion i gave earlier 18:49  So, I Believe I just try to do something that is not natural :) 18:49  which is to contact either jerome or ludovic 18:49  so, I will generate the HTML myself 18:49  who I know have done this 18:50  ok, but thx :) 18:50  you could generate the HTML but I agree it's not nice 18:51  all this is strange though 18:51  since I remember pushing some html in livetables in the past (not on purpose) 18:58  has quit 19:14  I have to go 19:14  good evening :) 19:14  has quit 19:14  bye 20:04  has left #xwiki 20:04  has joined #xwiki 20:12  I can't seem to get into the class editor for XWikiPreferences, every path I take fails to show the edit menu and only shows the admin app 20:12  I'm running as superadmin 20:14 <@sdumitriu> Lycurgus: You'll have to enter the URL manually 20:14  what is it? 20:15 <@sdumitriu> xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=class 20:15  thank you 20:19  (the parameter isn't needed just path member edit) 20:19  sorry just getting back into this 20:39  has joined #xwiki 21:36  has quit 21:42  has quit 22:04  has quit 23:31  has quit 23:52  has quit
